\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index::doc}}


\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{colabfit\sphinxhyphen{}tools}} is a package for constructing, manipulating, and
exploring datasets for data\sphinxhyphen{}driven interatomic potentials. This package is part
of the \sphinxhref{https://colabfit.openkim.org/}{ColabFit project} at the University of
Minnesota.

\label{\detokenize{overview:overview}}\label{\detokenize{overview::doc}}

graphic of how a dataset is organized. Explain why the package is useful, etc.


\chapter{Getting started}
\label{\detokenize{getting_started:getting-started}}\label{\detokenize{getting_started::doc}}

\section{Installation}
\label{\detokenize{getting_started:installation}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Currently, installation is only supported using \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pip}} to install directly
from the private GitHub repository.


\subsection{Using pip}
\label{\detokenize{getting_started:using-pip}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZdl{} }pip install git+https://\PYGZlt{}username\PYGZus{}or\PYGZus{}pat\PYGZgt{}@github.com/colabfit/colabfit\PYGZhy{}tools.git
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Note that since \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{colabfit\sphinxhyphen{}tools}} is currently still a private project,
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textless{}username\_or\_pat\textgreater{}}} must either be your GitHub username (if you have access to the repository) or a
Personal Access Token that has appropriate permissions.

\chapter{Classes}
\label{\detokenize{classes:classes}}\label{\detokenize{classes:colabfit-tools}}\label{\detokenize{classes::doc}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{configuration:module-colabfit.tools.configuration}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!colabfit.tools.configuration@\spxentry{colabfit.tools.configuration}}\index{colabfit.tools.configuration@\spxentry{colabfit.tools.configuration}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A {\hyperref[\detokenize{configuration:colabfit.tools.configuration.Configuration}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Configuration}}}}} stores all of the information about an atomic
structure. The {\hyperref[\detokenize{configuration:colabfit.tools.configuration.Configuration}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Configuration}}}}} class inherits from the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ase.Atoms}}
class, and populates some required fields in its \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Atoms.info}} dictionary.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The most common use\sphinxhyphen{}case for building {\hyperref[\detokenize{configuration:colabfit.tools.configuration.Configuration}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Configuration}}}}} objects is to use
the {\hyperref[\detokenize{converters:colabfit.tools.converters.BaseConverter.load}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{load()}}}}} method of a
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{colabfit.tools.BaseConverter}} instance, which will call
{\hyperref[\detokenize{configuration:colabfit.tools.configuration.Configuration.from_ase}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Configuration.from\_ase()}}}}} on an existing \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ase.Atoms}} object.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{colabfit}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{tools}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{converters} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{EXYZConverter}

\PYG{n}{converter} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{EXYZConverter}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{n}{configurations} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{converter}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{load}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Configuration}
\label{\detokenize{configuration:configuration}}\label{\detokenize{configuration::doc}}\index{Configuration (class in colabfit.tools.configuration)@\spxentry{Configuration}\spxextra{class in colabfit.tools.configuration}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{configuration:colabfit.tools.configuration.Configuration}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{colabfit.tools.configuration.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Configuration}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{labels}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{constraints}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{o}{*}\DUrole{n}{args}}, \emph{\DUrole{o}{**}\DUrole{n}{kwargs}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A Configuration is an extension of an \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ase.Atoms}} object that is
guaranteed to have the following fields in its \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{info}} dictionary:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ATOMS\_ID\_FIELD}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ATOMS\_NAME\_FIELD}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ATOMS\_LABELS\_FIELD}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ATOMS\_CONSTRAINTS\_FIELD}}

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Constructs a Configuration. Calls \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ase.Atoms.\_\_init\_\_()}}, then
populates the additional required fields.
\index{\_\_hash\_\_() (colabfit.tools.configuration.Configuration method)@\spxentry{\_\_hash\_\_()}\spxextra{colabfit.tools.configuration.Configuration method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{configuration:colabfit.tools.configuration.Configuration.__hash__}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_\_hash\_\_}}}{}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Generates a hash for \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{self}} by hashing its length, constraints,
positions, (atomic) numbers, simulation cell, and periodic
boundary conditions

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{\_\_init\_\_() (colabfit.tools.configuration.Configuration method)@\spxentry{\_\_init\_\_()}\spxextra{colabfit.tools.configuration.Configuration method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{configuration:colabfit.tools.configuration.Configuration.__init__}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_\_init\_\_}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{labels}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{constraints}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{o}{*}\DUrole{n}{args}}, \emph{\DUrole{o}{**}\DUrole{n}{kwargs}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Constructs a Configuration. Calls \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ase.Atoms.\_\_init\_\_()}}, then
populates the additional required fields.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{from\_ase() (colabfit.tools.configuration.Configuration class method)@\spxentry{from\_ase()}\spxextra{colabfit.tools.configuration.Configuration class method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{configuration:colabfit.tools.configuration.Configuration.from_ase}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{classmethod\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{from\_ase}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{atoms}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Generates a {\hyperref[\detokenize{configuration:colabfit.tools.configuration.Configuration}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Configuration}}}}} from an \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ase.Atoms}} object.

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{property:module-colabfit.tools.property}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!colabfit.tools.property@\spxentry{colabfit.tools.property}}\index{colabfit.tools.property@\spxentry{colabfit.tools.property}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A {\hyperref[\detokenize{property:colabfit.tools.property.Property}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Property}}}}} is usually extracted from a
{\hyperref[\detokenize{configuration:colabfit.tools.configuration.Configuration}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Configuration}}}}} object using the
{\hyperref[\detokenize{dataset:colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset.parse_data}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{parse\_data()}}}}} of a {\hyperref[\detokenize{dataset:colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Dataset()}}}}} object.


\section{Property}
\label{\detokenize{property:property}}\label{\detokenize{property::doc}}\index{Property (class in colabfit.tools.property)@\spxentry{Property}\spxextra{class in colabfit.tools.property}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{property:colabfit.tools.property.Property}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{colabfit.tools.property.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Property}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{name}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{configurations}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{property\_map}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{settings}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{edn}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{instance\_id}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{1}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{convert\_units}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A Property is used to store the results of some kind of calculation or
experiment, and should be mapped to an \sphinxhref{https://openkim.org/doc/schema/properties-framework/}{OpenKIM Property Definition}. Best
practice is for the Property to also point to one or more
PropertySettings objects that fully define the conditions under which the
Property was obtained.
\index{edn (colabfit.tools.property.Property attribute)@\spxentry{edn}\spxextra{colabfit.tools.property.Property attribute}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{property:colabfit.tools.property.Property.edn}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{edn}}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A dictionary defining an OpenKIM Property Instance in EDN format.
For more details, see the \sphinxhref{https://openkim.org/doc/schema/properties-framework/}{OpenKIM Property Framework} documentation.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
dict

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{property\_map (colabfit.tools.property.Property attribute)@\spxentry{property\_map}\spxextra{colabfit.tools.property.Property attribute}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{property:colabfit.tools.property.Property.property_map}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{property\_map}}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
key = a string that can be used as a key like \sphinxtitleref{self.edn{[}key{]}}
value = A sub\sphinxhyphen{}dictionary with the following keys:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} \begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{field}}:}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
A field name used to access \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Configuration.info}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Configuration.arrays}}

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{units}}:}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
A string matching one of the units names in \sphinxhref{https://wiki.fysik.dtu.dk/ase/ase/units.html}{ase.units}.
These units will be used to convert the given units to eV,
Angstrom, a.m.u., Kelvin, … For compound units (e.g. “eV/Ang”), the string will be split on
‘*’ and ‘/’. The raw data will be multiplied by the first unit
and anything preceded by a ‘*’. It will be divided by anything
preceded by a ‘/’.

\end{description}

\end{itemize}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
dict

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{configurations (colabfit.tools.property.Property attribute)@\spxentry{configurations}\spxextra{colabfit.tools.property.Property attribute}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{property:colabfit.tools.property.Property.configurations}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{configurations}}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A list of {\hyperref[\detokenize{configuration:colabfit.tools.configuration.Configuration}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Configuration}}}}} objects.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{property_settings:module-colabfit.tools.property_settings}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!colabfit.tools.property\_settings@\spxentry{colabfit.tools.property\_settings}}\index{colabfit.tools.property\_settings@\spxentry{colabfit.tools.property\_settings}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
It is best practice to attach a {\hyperref[\detokenize{property_settings:colabfit.tools.property_settings.PropertySettings}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PropertySettings}}}}} object to a
{\hyperref[\detokenize{property:colabfit.tools.property.Property}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Property}}}}} instance in order to better document
the conditions under which the property was computed. This would often include
information such as the DFT software package, a description of the calculation,
and an example file for running the calculation.


\section{PropertySettings}
\label{\detokenize{property_settings:propertysettings}}\label{\detokenize{property_settings::doc}}\index{PropertySettings (class in colabfit.tools.property\_settings)@\spxentry{PropertySettings}\spxextra{class in colabfit.tools.property\_settings}}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{converters:module-colabfit.tools.converters}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!colabfit.tools.converters@\spxentry{colabfit.tools.converters}}\index{colabfit.tools.converters@\spxentry{colabfit.tools.converters}!module@\spxentry{module}}

\section{Converter}
\label{\detokenize{converters:converter}}\label{\detokenize{converters::doc}}\index{BaseConverter (class in colabfit.tools.converters)@\spxentry{BaseConverter}\spxextra{class in colabfit.tools.converters}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{converters:colabfit.tools.converters.BaseConverter}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{colabfit.tools.converters.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{BaseConverter}}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A Converter is used to load a list of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ase.Atoms}} objects and convert
them to {\hyperref[\detokenize{configuration:colabfit.tools.configuration.Configuration}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Configuration}}}}} objects.
\index{load() (colabfit.tools.converters.BaseConverter method)@\spxentry{load()}\spxextra{colabfit.tools.converters.BaseConverter method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{converters:colabfit.tools.converters.BaseConverter.load}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{load}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{file\_path}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{name\_field}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{elements}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{default\_name}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}\textquotesingle{}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{labels\_field}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{verbose}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{o}{**}\DUrole{n}{kwargs}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Loads a list of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Configuration}}
objects.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{file\_path}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The path to the data files.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{name\_field}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The key for accessing the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{info}} dictionary of a
Configuration object to return the name of the Configuration.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{elements}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} A list of strings of element names. Order matters or file types
where a mapping from atom number to element type isn’t provided
(e.g., CFG files).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{default\_name}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The name to attach to the Configuration object if \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{name\_field}}
does not exist on \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Configuration.info}}. Default is an
empty string.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{labels\_field}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The key for accessing the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{info}} dictionary of a
Configuration object that returns a set of string labels.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{verbose}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} If True, prints the loading progress. Default is False.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\index{FolderConverter (class in colabfit.tools.converters)@\spxentry{FolderConverter}\spxextra{class in colabfit.tools.converters}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{converters:colabfit.tools.converters.FolderConverter}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{colabfit.tools.converters.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{FolderConverter}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{reader}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This converter serves as a generic template from loading configurations from
collections of files. It is useful for loading from storage formats like
JSON, HDF5, or nested folders of output files from DFT codes.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxtitleref{atoms.arrays}.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\index{\_load() (colabfit.tools.converters.FolderConverter method)@\spxentry{\_load()}\spxextra{colabfit.tools.converters.FolderConverter method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{converters:colabfit.tools.converters.FolderConverter._load}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_load}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{file\_path}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{name\_field}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{elements}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{default\_name}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{labels\_field}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{verbose}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{glob\_string}}, \emph{\DUrole{o}{**}\DUrole{n}{kwargs}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Arguments are the same as for other converters, but with the following
changes:
\begin{quote}
\begin{description}
\item[{file\_path (str):}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
The path to the parent directory containing the data files.

\item[{glob\_string (str):}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
A string to use with \sphinxtitleref{Path(file\_path).rglob(glob\_string)} to
generate a list of files to be passed to \sphinxtitleref{self.reader}

\end{description}
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
All additional kwargs will be passed to the reader function as
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{self.reader(..., **kwargs)}}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\index{dataset\_from\_config\_sets() (colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset method)@\spxentry{dataset\_from\_config\_sets()}\spxextra{colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{dataset:colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset.dataset_from_config_sets}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{dataset\_from\_config\_sets}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{cs\_ids}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{exclude}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{verbose}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns a new dataset that only contains the specified configuration
sets.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{cs\_ids}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} The index of the configuration set(s) to use for building the
new dataset. If \sphinxtitleref{self} is a parent dataset, then \sphinxtitleref{cs\_ids} shoud
either be a 2\sphinxhyphen{}tuple or a list of 2\sphinxhyphen{}tuples (i, j), where the
configuration sets will be indexed as
\sphinxtitleref{dataset.data{[}i{]}.configuration\_sets{[}j{]}}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{exclude}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} If False, builds a new dataset using all of the configuration
sets \_except\_ those specified by \sphinxtitleref{cs\_ids}. Default is False.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{verbose}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} If True, prints progress. Default is False

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
The new dataset. If \sphinxtitleref{self} is a parent dataset, then the new
dataset will also be a parent dataset.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
ds ({\hyperref[\detokenize{dataset:colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset}]{\sphinxcrossref{Dataset}}})

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{filter() (colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset method)@\spxentry{filter()}\spxextra{colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{dataset:colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset.filter}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{filter}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{filter\_type}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{filter\_fxn}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{copy}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{verbose}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A helper function for filtering on a Dataset. A filter is specified by
providing  a \sphinxtitleref{filter\_type} and a \sphinxtitleref{filter\_fxn}. In the case of a parent
dataset, the filter is applied to each of the children individually.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Examples:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Filter based on configuration name}
\PYG{n}{regex} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{re}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{compile}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{example\PYGZus{}name.*}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{n}{filtered\PYGZus{}dataset} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{dataset}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{filter}\PYG{p}{(}
    \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{configurations}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{k}{lambda} \PYG{n}{c}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{regex}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{search}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{c}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{info}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{ATOMS\PYGZus{}NAME\PYGZus{}FIELD}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Filter based on maximum force component}
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{numpy} \PYG{k}{as} \PYG{n+nn}{np}

\PYG{n}{filtered\PYGZus{}dataset} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{dataset}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{filter}\PYG{p}{(}
    \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{data}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{k}{lambda} \PYG{n}{p}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{np}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{max}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{np}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{abs}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{p}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{edn}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{unrelaxed\PYGZhy{}potential\PYGZhy{}forces}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{source\PYGZhy{}value}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}} \PYG{l+m+mf}{1.0}
\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{filter\_type}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
One of ‘configurations’ or ‘data’.
\begin{description}
\item[{If \sphinxtitleref{filter\_type == ‘configurations’}:}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
Filters on configurations, and returns a dataset with only
the configurations and their linked properties.

\item[{If \sphinxtitleref{filter\_type == ‘data’}:}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
Filters on properties, and returns a dataset with only the
properties and their linked configurations.

\end{description}


\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{filter\_fxn}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{callable}}) \textendash{} A callable function to use as \sphinxtitleref{filter(filter\_fxn)}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{copy}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} If True, deep copies all dataset attributes before returning
filtered results. Default is False.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
A Dataset object constructed by applying the specified filter,
extracting any objects linked to the filtered object, then
copying over \sphinxtitleref{property\_map}, \sphinxtitleref{configuration\_label\_regexes},
\sphinxtitleref{configuration\_set\_regexes}, and \sphinxtitleref{property\_settings\_regexes}.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
dataset ({\hyperref[\detokenize{dataset:colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset}]{\sphinxcrossref{Dataset}}})

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{flatten() (colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset method)@\spxentry{flatten()}\spxextra{colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{dataset:colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset.flatten}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{flatten}}}{}{}~\begin{description}
\item[{Pseudocode:}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
convert everything to the same units

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
merge authors/links

\item {} \begin{description}
\item[{warn if overlap (maybe this should be done in attach()?)}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
tell me which dataset has an overlap with which other (disjoint)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
optionally merge subset datasets

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
check if conflicting CO labels, CS regexes, or PS regexes

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\index{get\_data() (colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset method)@\spxentry{get\_data()}\spxextra{colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{dataset:colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset.get_data}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_data}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{property\_field}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{cs\_ids}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{exclude}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{concatenate}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{ravel}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns a list of properties obtained by looping over \sphinxtitleref{self.data} and
extracting the desired field if it exists on the property.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Note that if the field does not exist on the property, that property
will be skipped. This means that if there are multiple properties linked
to a single configuration, \sphinxtitleref{len(get\_data(…))} will not be the same as
\sphinxtitleref{len(self.configurations)}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{property\_field}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The string key used to extract the property values from the
Property objects

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{cs\_ids}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The integers specifying the configuration sets to obtain the
data from. Default is None, which returns data from all
configuration sets.

\sphinxAtStartPar
If \sphinxtitleref{self} is a base dataset, then \sphinxtitleref{cs\_ids} should be a list of
integers used for indexing \sphinxtitleref{self.configuration\_sets}.

\sphinxAtStartPar
If \sphinxtitleref{self} is a parent dataset, then \sphinxtitleref{cs\_ids} should be a list of
2\sphinxhyphen{}tuples \sphinxtitleref{(i, j)} where a configuration set will be indexed
using \sphinxtitleref{self.data{[}i{]}.configuration\_sets{[}j{]}}.


\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{exclude}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} Only to be used when \sphinxtitleref{cs\_ids} is not None. If \sphinxtitleref{exclude==True},
then data is only returned for the configuration sets that are
\_not\_ in \sphinxtitleref{cs\_ids}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{concatenate}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} If True, calls np.concatenate() on the list before returning.
Default is False.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ravel}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} If True, calls np.concatenate() on the list before returning.
Default is False.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns a list of Numpy arrays that were constructed by calling
{[}np.atleast\_1d(d{[}property\_field{]}{[}‘source\sphinxhyphen{}value’{]}) for d in self.data{]}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{get\_statistics() (colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset method)@\spxentry{get\_statistics()}\spxextra{colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{dataset:colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset.get_statistics}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_statistics}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{property\_field}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Builds an list by extracting the values of \sphinxtitleref{property\_field} for
each entry in the dataset, wrapping them in a numpy array, and
concatenating them all together. Then returns statistics on the
resultant array.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
\begin{description}
\item[{results (dict)::}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{..code\sphinxhyphen{}block::}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
\{‘average’: np.average(data), ‘std’: np.std(data), ‘min’: np.min(data), ‘max’: np.max(data), ‘average\_abs’: np.average(np.abs(data))\}

\end{description}

\end{description}


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{merge() (colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset method)@\spxentry{merge()}\spxextra{colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{dataset:colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset.merge}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{merge}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{other}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{clean}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Merges the new and current Datasets. Note that the current data
supersedes any incoming data. This means that if incoming data points
to an existing configuration, the incoming data is not added to the
Dataset because it is assumed that the existing data pointing to the
same configuration is the more important version.
\begin{description}
\item[{The following additional changes are made to the incoming data:}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Configurations are renamed to prepend the name of their datasets

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
All regexes are renamed as f”\textasciicircum{}\{other.name\}\_.*\{regex\}”

\end{itemize}

\end{description}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{other}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{dataset:colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Dataset}}}}}) \textendash{} The new dataset to be added to the existing one.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{clean}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} If True, checks for duplicates after merging. Default is False.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{parse\_data() (colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset method)@\spxentry{parse\_data()}\spxextra{colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{dataset:colabfit.tools.dataset.Dataset.parse_data}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{parse\_data}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{convert\_units}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{verbose}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Re\sphinxhyphen{}constructs \sphinxtitleref{self.data} by building a list of Property objects using
\sphinxtitleref{self.property\_map} and \sphinxtitleref{self.configurations}. Modifies \sphinxtitleref{self.data} in
place. If \sphinxtitleref{convert\_units==True}, then the units in \sphinxtitleref{self.property\_map}
are also updated.

\end{fulllineitems}

\section{Transform}
\label{\detokenize{transformations:transform}}\label{\detokenize{transformations::doc}}\index{BaseTransform (class in colabfit.tools.transformations)@\spxentry{BaseTransform}\spxextra{class in colabfit.tools.transformations}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{transformations:colabfit.tools.transformations.BaseTransform}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{colabfit.tools.transformations.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{BaseTransform}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{tform}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A Transform is used for processing raw data before loading it into a
Dataset. For example for things like subtracting off a reference energy or
extracting the 6\sphinxhyphen{}component version of the cauchy stress from a 3x3 matrix.
